title: Unconditionally fully initialized variable errors with possibly uninitialized
body:
This works ([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2015&gist=254e1aeed17fc66ae7d91858af5dac9a)):

```rust
pub unsafe fn foo() -> u32 {
    let r: u32;
    asm!("cpuid\n"
             : "={eax}"(r)
             : "{eax}"(0), "{ecx}"(0)
             : "rbx" :);
    r
}
```

but this fails ([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2015&gist=60265a89524ff9ed18470254e3fb36e7)):

```rust
pub struct A { pub eax: u32 }
pub unsafe fn bar() -> A {
    let r: A;
    asm!("cpuid\n"
             : "={eax}"(r.eax)
             : "{eax}"(0), "{ecx}"(0)
             : "rbx" :);
    r
}
```

with

```
error[E0594]: cannot assign to field `r.eax` of immutable binding
 --> src/lib.rs:7:25
  |
5 |     let r: A;
  |         - help: make this binding mutable: `mut r`
6 |     asm!("cpuid\n"
7 |              : "={eax}"(r.eax)
  |                         ^^^^^ cannot mutably borrow field of immutable binding

error[E0381]: use of possibly uninitialized variable: `r`
  --> src/lib.rs:10:5
   |
10 |     r
   |     ^ use of possibly uninitialized `r`
```

In particular, making `r` `mut` ([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2015&gist=096055d59b160a7225cff2010b703490)): 

```rust
pub struct A { pub eax: u32 }
pub unsafe fn bar() -> A {
    let mut r: A;
    asm!("cpuid\n"
             : "={eax}"(r.eax)
             : "{eax}"(0), "{ecx}"(0)
             : "rbx" :);
    r
}
```

still errors with:

```
error[E0381]: use of possibly uninitialized variable: `r`
  --> src/lib.rs:10:5
   |
10 |     r
   |     ^ use of possibly uninitialized `r`
```

even though `r` is fully initialized. However this works ([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2015&gist=690e31e1f53adeec7575ff1e63dfd3b1)):

```rust
pub struct A { pub eax: u32 }
pub unsafe fn bar() -> A {
    let r: u32;
    asm!("cpuid\n"
             : "={eax}"(r)
             : "{eax}"(0), "{ecx}"(0)
             : "rbx" :);
    A{ eax: r }
}
```

I expected that all of these would either work, or not work. They all look the same to me.
